intro: Borreria eupatorioides, commonly known as false spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Borreria eupatorioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
